basic_disciplines.name: Soldier
basic_disciplines.strengths: Soldiers are simple, they hit hard and their Spirit Burst lets them hit hard some more. Peacekeepers are more durable due to their ability to use more medication, while Rangers have more utility and mobility options to keep them out of harm’s way.
basic_disciplines.weaknesses: Soldiers don’t have many Mind Points, making them vulnerable to MP damage.

features.name: Weapon Drill
features.description: If your favored weapon has either the Machinarm A or Machinarm B tag, add an additional +2 to the weapon’s base damage. This bonus stacks with the original Weapon Drill feature.

features.name: Identify Threat
features.description: When you’re examining a wound, you can immediately know if it’s caused by a weapon and its type. You immediately recognize the weapon when you see it.

features.name: Scout Operative
features.description: You only need the bare essentials to survive and have learned to pack light. You gain an additional Item Slot as long as you have this feature.

features.name: Multistrike
features.description: When you make a Major Attack, you can spend 3 Spirit Tokens to make an additional Major Attack. After spending the initial 3 Spirit Tokens, the cost of each subsequent Major Attack is reduced to 2 Spirit Tokens until the end of the turn. You can make as many additional Major Attacks as you want, as long as you fulfill the Spirit Token cost.

features.name: Emergency Medication
features.description: When receiving the effects of medicines, such as Healing Powder or Refresh Dust of any grade, your HP or MP recovery is increased by +10.

features.name: Adaptable Shot
features.description: Using your Major Action, you can perform the Run & Gun action, allowing you to make a Ranged Attack and move, in whichever order you prefer. A target hit by this Ranged Attack cannot make an Opportunity Strike until the end of the turn.

features.name: Weapon Drill +
features.description: (This feature augments the Weapon Drill feature with new functions.) You can now have 2 Item Slot’s worth of favored weaponry at a time (increased from 1).

features.name: Weapon Drill ++
features.description: (Instant) (This feature augments the Weapon Drill+ feature with new functions.) You can switch between your favored weapons at any instance with a Free Action even outside of your turn. (For example, if you are wielding your favored greatsword and a monster attacks you, you can switch to your favored sword and shield instantly.)

features.name: Identify Threat +
features.description: (Adventuring Feature) (This feature augments the Identify Threat feature with new functions.) When you’re examining a wound, you can immediately know if it’s caused by a weapon and its type. You immediately recognize the weapon when you see it.

features.name: Scout Operative +
features.description: (Adventuring Feature) (This feature augments the Scout Operative feature with new functions.) You only need the bare essentials to survive and have learned to pack light. You gain an additional Item Slot as long as you have this feature.

features.name: Emergency Medication +
features.description: (Instant) (This feature augments the Emergency Medication feature with new functions.) When receiving the effects of medicines, such as Healing Powder or Refresh Dust of any grade, your HP or MP recovery is increased by +10.

features.name: Adaptable Shot +
features.description: (This feature augments the Adaptable Shot feature with new functions.) Using your Major Action, you can perform the Run & Gun action, allowing you to make a Ranged Attack and move, in whichever order you prefer. A target hit by this Ranged Attack cannot make an Opportunity Strike until the end of the turn.

features.name: Weapon Drill +++
features.description: (This feature augments the Weapon Drill++ feature with new functions.) If your favored weapon has either the Machinarm A or Machinarm B tag, add an additional +2 to the weapon’s base damage. This bonus stacks with the original Weapon Drill feature.

features.name: Multistrike + (3 Spirit Tokens)
features.description: (This feature overwrites the Multistrike feature and doesn’t stack with it.) When you make a Major Attack, you can spend 3 Spirit Tokens to make an additional Major Attack. After spending the initial 3 Spirit Tokens, the cost of each subsequent Major Attack is reduced to 2 Spirit Tokens until the end of the turn. You can make as many additional Major Attacks as you want, as long as you fulfill the Spirit Token cost. You also get a temporary minor action for each multistrike, which you can use before or after the attack. The unused temporary minor action is forfeited if you make another multistrike or your turn ends.

basic_disciplines.advanced_path: Weapon Master Discipline or Commander Discipline when you reach rank 4 in either of the Classes above.

basic_disciplines.name: Champion
basic_disciplines.advanced_path: Commander Discipline or Paragon Discipline when you reach rank 4 in either of the Classes above.
basic_disciplines.strengths: Champions are durable and versatile team players and defenders. They improve the effectiveness of their wards and have the toughness to absorb plenty of damage for their comrades. Templar’s protection improves damage, while Samurai’s improves accuracy.
basic_disciplines.weaknesses: Champions work best in a group and struggle when alone. They can’t deal burst damage, so they will have trouble fighting enemies that grow progressively more powerful over time.

features.name: Classical Education
features.description: (Adventuring Feature) You are educated in the arts and history of various nations and had to attend choir classes. You can make Information Skill Rolls with Edge to figure out the history of relics and ruins. You can also make Artistry Skill Rolls with Edge to sing or mimic sounds.

features.name: Templar’s Protection
features.description: Using your minor action, you can provide protection bonuses to a target creature other than yourself within 30m (3 zones) of you. The target gains a +1 Defense and +2 Damage Bonus to all damage dealt. A target cannot benefit from the effects of multiple Templar’s Protections even when they come from multiple sources. Your protection lasts for 5 minutes (25 turns) or ends early if the target moves out of range or you are downed.

features.name: Graceful Envoy
features.description: (Adventuring Feature) You are highly trained in the arts of diplomacy. You can always identify the leader or highest ranked persons or monsters within 50m (5 zones) from you (Ask your GM). You can know the rank of monsters you can see (Normal, Captain or Boss) without needing to analyze them.

features.name: Samurai’s Protection
features.description: Using your minor action, you can provide protection bonuses to a target creature other than yourself within 30m (3 zones) of you. The target gains a +1 Defense and +1 Combat Roll Bonus. A target cannot benefit from the effects of multiple Samurai’s Protections even when they come from multiple sources. Your protection lasts for 5 minutes (25 turns) or ends early if the target moves out of range or you are downed.

features.name: Arcane Attunement
features.description: You can attune to Arcane Elements, such as Fire, Water, Wood, Wind, Earth, Metal, and other elements derived from their combinations. Using your minor action, you can create a Spellglyph Token. You may choose to enter combat or other Critical Situations, with 3 Spellglyph Tokens.

features.name: Attunement Slot +1
features.description: You gain +1 additional Attunement Slot. Each Attunement Slot increases your maximum MP by 10. (Stacks with other Attunement Slots.)

features.name: Warcasting
features.description: When you cast spells that enchant only yourself or your equipment, those spells cannot be disrupted by taking damage.

features.name: Relentless Challenger
features.description: When you attack with your melee weapon, you can place a Mark of Challenge on your target even if the attack misses. When your marked target uses its action to attack or effect any target besides yourself, you can use your Free Action to make a Major Melee Weapon attack on it after it completes its action. You can only mark one target at a time.

features.name: Spirit Burst: Aegis Shroud
features.description: (2 Spirit Tokens) (Instant) Protect your ward with a magical shroud and transfer the damage to yourself. You can spend 2 Spirit Tokens at any time and use your Free Action to place an Aegis Shroud on your target. Additionally, you may also move your class’ (Templar/Samurai) protection feature to the target. The next time the target affected by Aegis Shroud takes any HP, MP, or Resolve damage, the damage is absorbed by the shroud and reallocated to you as HP damage. This reallocated damage cannot be reduced. The Aegis Shroud loses its effect after it has absorbed damage once or after 5 minutes (25 turns). Alternatively, you can dismiss this effect at any time with your Free Action.

features.name: Classical Education +
features.description: (Adventuring Feature) (This feature augments the Classical Education feature with new functions.) You gain a +1 to both your Information & Artistry Skills.

features.name: Templar’s Protection +
features.description: (This feature augments the Templar’s Protection feature with new functions.) The target now gains a +1 Defense and gets +4 Damage Bonus for every instance of damage dealt. (Does not stack with the previous version.)

features.name: Graceful Envoy +
features.description: (Adventuring Feature) (This feature augments the Graceful Envoy feature with new functions.) You gain +1 to both your Psychology & Appeal Skills.

features.name: Samurai’s Protection +
features.description: (This feature augments the Samurai’s Protection feature with new functions.) The target now gains a +1 Defense and +2 Combat Roll Bonus. (Does not stack with the previous version)

features.name: Attunement Slot +1
features.description: You gain +1 additional Attunement Slot. Each Attunement Slot increases your maximum MP by 10. (Stacks with other Attunement Slots.)

features.name: Warcasting +
features.description: You can use your minor action to enchant non-machinarm weapons you are wielding to make them deal the damage Type of an element you’re attuned to and change the damage Method to Spell instead of Weapon. This feature overrides the weapon’s damage Type even if it was already enhanced by spells, but it retains the spell’s bonuses. This feature lasts for 1 hour and you can dismiss this effect with your minor action.

features.name: Relentless Challenger +
features.description: (This feature augments the Relentless Challenger feature with new functions.) If a target is hit by your Opportunity Strike while moving, you can choose to cancel the associated unit’s movement and stop it in your zone. The action it used to move is expended, and it cannot use its actions to move until the start of its next turn.

features.name: Spirit Burst: Aegis Shroud +
features.description: (This feature augments the Aegis Shroud feature with new functions.) When a target affected by your Aegis Shroud takes any HP, MP, or Resolve damage, the damage is absorbed by the shroud and you can reallocate the damage to your HP and MP at any ratio. This reallocated damage cannot be reduced.

basic_disciplines.name: Thaumathurgist
basic_disciplines.advanced_path: Paragon Discipline or Sage Discipline when you reach rank 4 in either of the Classes above.

features.name: Cosmic Attunement
features.description: You can attune to Cosmic Elements, such as Order, Chaos, and Astral. Using your minor action, you can create a Spellglyph Token. You may choose to enter combat or other Critical Situations, with 3 Spellglyph Tokens.

features.name: Attunement Slot +2
features.description: You gain +2 additional Attunement Slots. Each Attunement Slot increases your maximum MP by 10. (Stacks with other Attunement Slots.)

features.name: Physician
features.description: You have Edge on Chemist Kit Rolls. You can immediately know if a creature you see is sick or affected by any substance, ailment, or spell and you know what caused it.

features.name: Potent Healing
features.description: Improve the potency of your healing. You can use a recovery item (such as Healing Powder) on a target without giving it the Medicated condition or you can use a recovery item on an already Medicated target. This feature can be used once and is reusable after taking a Full Rest.

features.name: Seance
features.description: When you touch the corpse or remains of a creature that is not an undead, you can use your minor action to raise its lingering spirit and talk to it. The spirit is not necessarily cooperative and may be hostile towards you. This effect lasts for 10 minutes. This feature can be used once and is reusable after taking a Long Break.

features.name: Dogmatism
features.description: Whenever your focus on a spell is disrupted, you can use your Free Action to instantly repay the MP cost of the spell and renew your focus. The duration of the spell is also renewed.

features.name: Spirit Burst: War Chant
features.description: (2 Spirit Tokens) (Instant) Manipulate fate and turn crisis into opportunity. This feature is only usable in Critical Situations. When you see a friendly or willing target within 30m (3 zones) of you making a Task or a Combat Roll, you can instantly spend 2 Spirit Tokens to ignore the result and let the target reroll its dice. The new roll ignores Edge and Setback, but the result must be used. This burst can be used in succession if you have the Spirit Tokens to spend.

features.name: Cosmic Profiling
features.description: Your deep knowledge of the Cosmic Elements allows you to enhance their prowess. You ignore a target’s resistance to your Cosmic Spell’s damage, dealing full damage instead of half. (This feature does not override immunity.)

features.name: Cosmic Shift
features.description: Your familiarity with the pillars of Cosmic Elements allows you to swap your Cosmic Attunements in an emergency. You can use your minor action to swap a Cosmic Element you’re attuned with for another Cosmic Element. This feature can be used twice and is reusable after taking a Full Rest.

features.name: Attunement Slot +2
features.description: You gain +2 additional Attunement Slots. Each Attunement Slot increases your maximum MP by 10. (Stacks with other Attunement Slots.)

features.name: Physician +
features.description: (Adventuring Feature) While taking a break, you can provide therapeutic care to other targets. While taking a Short or Long Break, you can spend your own Resolve Points to recover other characters’ HP & MP.

features.name: Potent Healing +
features.description: (This feature augments the Potent Healing feature with new functions.) Whenever you recover the HP or MP of a target through spells, features, or items, increase the result by +5.

features.name: Seance +
features.description: (Adventuring Feature) When you touch the corpse or remains of a creature that is not undead, you can use your minor action, and experience the last 5 minutes of its life. While you’re experiencing this, you share all the dead creature’s senses. This experience is so unsettling, you lose 2d6 MP whenever you use this feature.

features.name: Dogmatism +
features.description: (This feature augments the Dogmatism feature with new functions.) You can focus on two ongoing spells at once. When your focus is disrupted, both spells lose their effects. You can repay the MP costs of the spells to renew your focus on one or both. For example, you can have both Rigid Mind and Dissipate Force active at the same time.

features.name: Cosmic Profiling +
features.description: (This feature augments the Cosmic Profiling feature with new functions.) When a creature is weak to any of your Cosmic Elements spells, you deal it three times the damage instead of double.

features.name: Cosmic Shift +
features.description: (This feature augments the Cosmic Shift feature with new functions.) You now have the option to use your minor action and spend 15MP to swap a Cosmic Element you’re attuned with for another Cosmic Element.

features.name: Spirit Burst: War Chant +
features.description: (2 Spirit Tokens) (Instant) (This feature augments the War Chant feature with new functions.) This feature can now be used on enemies and other unwilling targets in combat and other Critical Situations.

basic_disciplines.name: Arcanist
basic_disciplines.advanced_path: Sage Discipline or Martial Arcanist Discipline when you reach rank 4 in either of the Classes above.
basic_disciplines.strengths: Arcanists are versatile spellcasters who can attune to the Arcane Elements. They have access to a plethora of Arcane Spells that can help them solve virtually any adventuring problem and devastate multiple enemies at once. Spellweavers can blast enemy groups without needing to worry about friendly fire, while Glamour Guards are more defensive.
basic_disciplines.weaknesses: Arcanists are glass cannons. They hit hard but can’t withstand much enemy punishment. Enemies that can flank or bypass the frontline pose great danger to them.

features.name: Arcane Attunement
features.description: You have received training in the manipulation of Arcane Elements. You can attune to Arcane Elements, such as Fire, Water, Wood, Wind, Earth, Metal, and other elements derived from their combinations. Using your minor action, you can create a Spellglyph Token. You may choose to enter combat or other Critical Situations with 3 Spellglyph Tokens.

features.name: Attunement Slot +2
features.description: You gain +2 additional Attunement Slots. Each Attunement Slot increases your maximum MP by 10. (Stacks with other Attunement Slots.)

features.name: Spell Sensitivity
features.description: You become highly sensitive to the flow of magical currents. You can sense any spells cast within 100m and the lingering effects of spells on any creatures or objects up to 30m away from you.

features.name: Arcane Reflow
features.description: None of the spells you cast can affect or deal damage to your allies unless you allow them to. This includes spells you are actively focusing on.

features.name: Glamour
features.description: Using your minor action, you cocoon yourself in a ball of shimmering light and replicate the look of a costume you have seen before or designed yourself. Lasts for 1 hour or until you use your minor action to dispel it. Reverts to your original clothing at the end of this effect.

features.name: Glamour Gear
features.description: Using your minor action, you manifest and wear your imagined combat costume in a flash of transmogrifying light. You gain 1 Barrier Token if you currently don’t have any. You can choose to enter combat or other Critical Situations in your Glamour Gear with 1 Barrier Token.

features.name: Spirit Burst: Quick Casting
features.description: By spending 3 Spirit Tokens as a Free Action on your turn, you can use your minor action to cast spells that require a Major Action to cast. The restriction on only casting two spells per turn still applies. This effect lasts until the end of your turn.

features.name: Arcane Profiling
features.description: You ignore a target’s resistance to your Arcane Spell’s damage, dealing full damage instead of half. (This feature does not override immunity.)

features.name: Arcane Shift
features.description: Using your minor action, you can swap an Arcane Element you’re attuned with for another Arcane Element. This feature can be used twice and is reusable after taking a Full Rest.

features.name: Attunement Slot +2
features.description: You gain +2 additional Attunement Slots. Each Attunement Slot increases your maximum MP by 10. (Stacks with other Attunement Slots.)

features.name: Spell Sensitivity +
features.description: Your arcane sensitivity allows you to know whether a creature is a spellcaster on sight. You can also see any area that’s being affected or surveilled by magic even if the magic is invisible to the naked eye.

features.name: Arcane Reflow +
features.description: Extend the range of your spells by 20m (2 zones). This only works with spells that originally have a range of 10m (1 zone) and above.

features.name: Glamour +
features.description: When you use your minor action to dress yourself in a costume, you can also adjust your physical appearance to resemble a person you’re imagining. Alternatively, you can transform into a person you are looking at within 30m (3 zones) of you. This transformation lasts for 1 hour or until you use your minor action to dismiss it.

features.name: Glamour Gear +
features.description: While wearing your glamour gear, you also get a +1 bonus to your Defense. Using your minor action, you can instantly swap the Spell Garb or attire you’re wearing with another one in your inventory. This feature can be used three times and is reusable after taking a Full Rest.

features.name: Arcane Profiling +
features.description: When a creature is weak to any of your Arcane Elements spells, you deal it three times the damage instead of double.

features.name: Arcane Shift +
features.description: You now have the option to use your minor action and spend 15 MP to swap an Arcane Element you’re attuned with for another Arcane Element.

features.name: Spirit Burst: Quick Casting +
features.description: By spending 3 Spirit Tokens as a Free Action on your turn, you can use your minor action to cast spells that require a Major Action. The 2 spells per turn limit is raised to 3 until the end of the turn.

basic_disciplines.name: Martial Artist
basic_disciplines.strengths: Martial Artists are problem solvers who can move twice as far as other Disciplines and bring plenty of useful items. They are also above-average damage dealers in combat. Dragon Souls can shoot ki blasts from a safe distance while Tangling Rose can redirect attacks that miss them at the units they are grappling.
basic_disciplines.weaknesses: Martial Artists have below-average hit points and little to no way of damaging apparitions. When they encounter ghosts, the best option is to run.

gear_suggestions.others: Without the need for weapons and armor, the Martial Artists can carry more Toolkits and items. They can also use Martial Manuals.

features.name: Martial Arts
features.description: Your training in the martial arts enhances the destructive power of your Unarmed Combat. Your Unarmed Combat Rolls are considered as Martial Arts Combat Rolls and you have Mastery in them. Your base Martial Arts damage is 4 HP. When you deal damage with your Unarmed Combat Attacks, you can choose to deal the attack’s original damage (1 Blunt HP damage) or your Martial Arts damage. The damage Type is the same as your Unarmed Combat Attack (blunt).

features.name: Martial Arts Combo
features.description: After making a Martial Arts Attack with your Major Action, you can use your minor action to make a single Follow-Up Unarmed Combat Attack. This feature also applies to other Disciplines’ Martial Arts Attacks. You can make only 1 Follow-Up Attack now. But you can make more Follow-Up attacks when you get the improved version of this feature, Martial Arts Combo +.

features.name: Sense Aura
features.description: (Adventuring Feature) Using your minor action, you can sense the aura of all living creatures and apparitions within 30m (3 zones) of you, even if they’re hidden behind objects. This feature lasts for 12 seconds (1 round). You roughly know the number of creatures, their sizes, and general locations (The zones they’re in), but invisible creatures remain invisible to you. Construct creature types are undetectable by this feature.

features.name: Ki Blast
features.description: Your exceptional control over your ki allows you to throw devastating energy blasts. While you have a free hand, you can make Middle Ranged Ki Blast Attacks to replace your Unarmed Combat Attacks. This attack is a Martial Arts Attack and you deal your Martial Arts damage. The damage Type is Order and has a 10m (1 zone) range.

features.name: Winding Ways
features.description: (Adventuring Feature) You have Edge when making Task Rolls against hazards, including neutralizing those hazards. This feature can be used three times and is reusable after taking a Full Rest.

features.name: Tangling Hands
features.description: Your study of joint locks and geometry allows you to bind your enemy as you attack them. Whenever you successfully hit a target in the same zone as you with a Martial Arts Attack, you can choose to reduce the damage you deal by half (rounded down) and Grapple or Latch onto the target unit immediately, as long as it’s an eligible unit. Your damage is increased by +2 when attacking a target you’re grappling or latching onto. Additionally, when an opponent’s attack misses you, you can choose to make the attack hit one of the targets you’re grappling or latching onto. The target takes the base damage of the attack and any associated Bonus Damages, but the Excess Damage is ignored. This redirection also works with attacks made by a target you are currently grappling or latching onto, making it hit itself with its missed attack.

features.name: Spirit Burst: Clear Mind
features.description: By cleansing your mind from worldly distractions, you gain heightened reflexes and combat insights. On your turn, you can spend 2 Spirit Tokens as a Free Action to gain a +1 to your Combat Rolls, Defense, Physical Fortitude, and Mental Fortitude. This effect lasts for 5 minutes (25 rounds). Additionally, while this feature is active, any damage you deal with your Martial Arts Combat Rolls can’t be reduced by Barrier Tokens.

features.name: Wind Step
features.description: Your mastery over the cosmic forces allows you to manipulate your mass and challenge the laws of physics around you. You can easily run up steep slopes and vertical walls, allowing you to ignore such obstacles. You start falling at the end of the turn or after you have moved as far as your maximum movement speed allows.

features.name: Martial Arts +
features.description: This feature augments the Martial Arts feature with new functions. Your base Martial Arts damage is now 6 HP (Blunt). (Replaces the 4 damage of your Martial Arts feature).

features.name: Martial Arts Combo +
features.description: This feature augments the Martial Arts Combo feature with new functions. The maximum number of Follow-Up Attacks you can make with your Martial Arts Combo is now 2. You need to expend a minor action for each combo attack. This feature also increases the number of Martial Arcanist’s combo to 2. (Does not stack with previous features).

features.name: Sense Aura +
features.description: (Adventuring Feature) This feature augments the Sense Aura feature with new functions. Using your minor action, you gain astral sight for 12 seconds (1 round). Astral sight grants you the ability to see through material objects up to 30m (3 zones) away and see any invisible objects and creatures.

features.name: Ki Blast +
features.description: This feature augments the Ki Blast feature with new functions. Using your minor action, you can build up your internal ki reserve and increase the damage of your single next Martial Arts Attack. For each minor action you expend, increase your base Martial Arts damage by +6 and the range of your ki blast is increased by +10m (1 zone). This build-up can be stacked up to three times, to a maximum of +18 base damage and +30m (3 zones). This effect disappears after you make your Martial Arts Attack regardless of whether it hits, or after 5 minutes (25 rounds).

features.name: Winding Ways +
features.description: (Adventuring Feature) This feature augments the Winding Ways feature with new functions. You can climb any solid surface and move on it as easily as a spider. You can even stand upside down on a ceiling with no adverse effects.

features.name: Tangling Hands +
features.description: This feature augments the Tangling Hands feature with new functions. Targets 2 size categories larger than you are no longer immune to the negative effects of being Grappled by you. (If your size is medium, you can now Grapple Xtra Large targets). Maneuvers made against you are made with Setback. Whenever you attack a target you are grappling or latching onto, you can choose to make a Simultaneous Attack against all targets you are grappling or latching onto.

features.name: Martial Arts ++
features.description: This feature augments the Martial Arts + feature with new functions. Your base Martial Arts damage is now 8 HP (Blunt). (Replaces the damage of your Martial Arts and Superior Martial Arts feature).

features.name: Wind Step +
features.description: This feature augments the Wind Step feature with new functions. When you use your minor action to move, you temporarily gain “flight” by stepping on air. You lose your “flight” and fall at the end of the turn or after you have moved as far as your Maximum Movement Range allows. All fall damage you receive is halved. You can also use your minor action to reduce your body weight to the weight of a feather until the start of your next turn. When your body weight is reduced by this feature, you don’t take fall damage and can stand on the surface of water or a leaf on a branch.

features.name: Spirit Burst: Clear Mind +
features.description: (1 Spirit Token) (Instant) This feature augments the Clear Mind feature with new functions. You can now instantly activate this Spirit Burst before you take your first turn using your Free Action. Additionally, the cost is reduced to just 1 Spirit Token. You can also do this even if you’re Surprised.

basic_disciplines.name: Brute
basic_disciplines.strengths: Brutes are great defenders who can take damage for their allies and withstand more physical punishment than any other Discipline. Their Spirit Burst makes up for their initial low damage output. When your Primary Class is a Brute Discipline Class, you can choose to not wear any armor and gain the Defense & HP benefits of unarmored toughness.
basic_disciplines.weaknesses: Brutes are great at absorbing HP damage but not MP damage. They also have low Mental Fortitude rendering them vulnerable to mind control spells and effects.

gear_suggestions.weapon: Extra Heavy Weapons are great for Berserkers and shields are essential for Spartans.
gear_suggestions.armor: Medium Armor is better for enemies that deal effect damage. Unarmored Toughness is better for enemies that make Attack Rolls.

features.name: Spirit Burst: Grit
features.description: (1 Spirit Token) Whenever you receive an instance of HP damage, you can spend 1 Spirit Token to reduce the damage you receive by half, rounded down. You can’t reduce the damage to below 1.

features.name: Bear Power
features.description: (Adventuring Feature) Hone your brute strength to greater heights. You have Edge on all your Brute Skill Rolls.

features.name: Violent Interpose
features.description: (Instant) Jump in front of an assailant and take the attack. You gain 1 Spirit Token when you use this feature. When a target within 10m (1 zone) of you attacks you or your allies, you can instantly use your minor action to leap into the attacker’s zone and redirect the attack to yourself. The attacker has to target you now, even if you’re not the original target. This traversal method neither counts toward your Maximum Movement Range nor provokes Opportunity Strike. After the attack is made, regardless of whether it hits you, the attacker takes half of your wielded melee weapon’s damage. (Weapon Required) This feature can be used outside of your own turn, and you can also use it on yourself when you’re attacked. It does not work against Effect Rolls or Simultaneous Attack Rolls.

features.name: Adrenaline Rush
features.description: (Adventuring Feature) Your training made you a supreme athlete. You have Edge on all your Sports Skill Rolls.

features.name: Defensive Interpose
features.description: (Instant) Jump in front of an attacked ally and take the attack yourself. You gain 1 Spirit Token when you use this feature. When an ally within 10m (1 zone) of you is being attacked, you can instantly use your minor action to gain a +1 Defense Bonus and leap into your ally’s zone to redirect the attack to yourself. The attacker has to target you now, even if you’re not the original target. Alternatively, you can use this feature on yourself if you’re the target of an attack. This traversal method neither counts towards your Maximum Movement Range nor provokes Opportunity Strike. (Shield Required) This feature can be used outside of your own turn and you can also use it on yourself when you’re attacked. It does not work against Effect Rolls or Simultaneous Attack Rolls.

features.name: No Pain No Gain
features.description: Nothing is more invigorating than pain in battle! Whenever you receive HP damage, you gain 1 Spirit Token. (Tip: When an attack misses you, you can choose to take 1 damage instead to activate this feature.)

features.name: Scuffle Expert
features.description: You developed keen knowledge in the application of strength and violence. All Scuffle Maneuvers targeting you are made with Setback.

features.name: Spirit Burst: Brutal Rage
features.description: (3+ Spirit Tokens) (This feature overwrites the default Spirit Burst: Rage feature and doesn’t stack with it.) You have learned to channel your battle fever into greater rage. When you damage a target, you can spend Spirit Tokens to increase the damage you deal. For every Spirit Token you spend, you increase the damage you deal by 3 points. The minimum amount of spirit you need to spend to use this Spirit Burst feature is 3 Spirit Tokens.

features.name: Monstrous Strength
features.description: Increase your Primary Class’ Weapon Category Mastery by 1 weight class. For example, if you have Mastery in Heavy Weaponry, you gain Mastery of Xtra Heavy Weapons. Except for Xtra Heavy Weapons, you can now wield all two-handed melee weapons you have Mastery in with only 1 hand.

features.name: Bear Power +
features.description: (Adventuring Feature) (This feature augments the Bear Power feature with new functions) You gain a +2 bonus to your Brute Skill Rolls.

features.name: Adrenaline Rush +
features.description: (Adventuring Feature) (This feature augments the Adrenaline Rush feature with new functions) You gain a +2 bonus to your Sports Skill Rolls.

features.name: Violent Interpose +
features.description: (Instant) (This feature augments the Violent Interpose feature with new functions.) You can now leap up to 20m (2 zones) into an attacking opponent’s zone.

features.name: Defensive Interpose +
features.description: (Instant) (This feature augments the Defensive Interpose feature with new functions.) Anytime an ally within 30m (3 zones) of you is being targeted by an attack, you can instantly use your minor action to gain a +1 Defense Bonus and throw the shield you’re wielding in front of that target. You do not lose the Defense Bonus from your shield when it’s thrown using this feature. (Shield Required) The target’s Defense is temporarily raised to be the same as yours, if your Defense is higher. If the target you’re defending with this feature receives HP damage, you can use your Spirit Burst: Grit feature to reduce the damage received. Your shield boomerangs back to you after using this feature. This feature does not work against attacks and spells that target zones or Simultaneous Attacks. You also immediately gain 1 Spirit Token when you use this feature.

features.name: Scuffle Expert +
features.description: (This feature augments the Scuffle Expert feature with new functions) You have Edge on your Scuffle Maneuvers.

features.name: Spirit Burst: Brutal Rage +
features.description: (3+ Spirit Tokens) (This feature augments the Brutal Rage feature with new functions.) For every Spirit Token you spend, you now deal additional 5 points of damage. (Does not stack with the previous version).

basic_disciplines.name: Trickster
basic_disciplines.strengths: Tricksters are tremendously versatile high-speed supporters. Their Spirit Bursts allow them to disrupt and cancel enemy effects and actions, increasing the party’s survivability. Rogues are capable melee combatants while Bards are better supporters.
basic_disciplines.weaknesses: Tricksters have below-average hit points. To survive combat, they need to rely on their spells, features, and all the other tricks in the book. They also lack the features to deal burst damage.

gear_suggestions.weapon: Dual wield weapons work best for Rogue. Spell Catalyst or ranged weapons are great for Bards.

features.name: Master Thievery
features.description: (Adventuring Feature) Your art of Thievery is honed to greater heights. By spending a minor action, you find all the traps, hidden doors, or other secret contraptions within a 30m (3 zones) radius around you. This feature can be used once and it’s reusable after taking a Full Rest.

features.name: Dual Wielding Mastery
features.description: Your skill in dual wielded weaponry is unparalleled. When dual wielding, you can choose to calculate your base Defense as 7 + Mastery. Additionally, you do not need to use your minor action to make a Follow-Up Attack with your secondary weapon.

features.name: Sharp Remark
features.description: (Adventuring Feature) Encourage a creature to perform its task better. Using your minor action, you can instantly allow a creature to make its Task Roll with Edge. That creature must be within 30m (3 zones) of you and see or hear you. You can make 3 sharp remarks and you regain all uses after taking a Full Rest.

features.name: Rally
features.description: Sing, play an instrument, or say words of encouragement to lift a combatant’s spirit. While on your turn, you can use your minor action to grant 1 Spirit Token to a target of your choice besides yourself. You can’t grant more than 1 Spirit Token to a target per turn.

features.name: Arcane Attunement
features.description: You have received training in the manipulation of Arcane Elements. You can attune to Arcane Elements, such as Fire, Water, Wood, Wind, Earth, Metal, and other elements derived from their combinations. Using your minor action, you can create a Spellglyph Token. You may choose to enter combat or other Critical Situations, with 3 Spellglyph Tokens.

features.name: Attunement Slot +1
features.description: You gain +1 additional Attunement Slot. Each Attunement Slot increases your maximum MP by 10. (Stacks with other Attunement Slots.)

features.name: Warcasting
features.description: When you cast spells that enchant only yourself or your equipment, those spells cannot be disrupted by taking damage.

features.name: Dual Wielding Mastery +
features.description: (This feature augments the Dual Wielding Mastery feature with new functions.) While you’re dual wielding and applying an enchantment spell on your primary weapon, you can choose to apply the same effect to your secondary weapon at no cost.

features.name: Rally +
features.description: (This feature augments the Rally feature with new functions.) Every time you use your Rally feature, you also gain a Spellglyph Token.

features.name: Break Focus
features.description: Apply disruptive tricks into your combat style. When you deal any amount of HP or MP damage to a creature that is focusing on spells or other effects, you can choose to end their focus.

features.name: Spirit Burst: Cancel Action
features.description: (3 Spirit Tokens) (Instant) Disrupt and stop an enemy’s action by tactically throwing an object at it. You can spend 3 Spirit Tokens at any instant as a Free Action to throw a small object, such as a coin or a pebble, at a target within 30m (3 zones) of you to cancel its action. To do so, make a Middle Ranged Attack Roll with Mastery. Alternatively, you can make the attack with a thrown weapon you own and benefit from its bonuses. If your attack hits, the target takes no damage but its action is cancelled and expended. The target’s other resources for the action such as MP, Danger Token, or items are refunded. The target can’t make the same type of action (such as attacking, spellcasting, or moving) again for the rest of the turn.

features.name: Master Thievery +
features.description: (Adventuring Feature) (This feature augments the Master Thievery feature with new functions.) You gain a +2 bonus to your Thievery Skill Rolls.

features.name: Mirror Weapon
features.description: You can create a spectral duplicate of a weapon you are holding in one hand and dual wield them. Using a minor action, you can instantly create a duplicate of a weapon you hold in one hand in your other hand. This also means that you can dual wield any weapon that doesn’t require two hands to wield. The copy appears mirror-flipped and it will disappear the moment it leaves your hand. A copied magical weapon only retains the original’s Combat Roll Bonus, base damage, damage Type, and nothing else.

features.name: Sharp Remark +
features.description: (Adventuring Feature) (This feature augments the Sharp Remark feature with new functions.) Instead of using your sharp remark to encourage, you can use it to instantly distract a creature within 30m (3 zones) of you. That creature has Setback on its Task Roll.

features.name: Elemental Muse
features.description: Employ an elemental muse’s service to temporarily attune to an additional element. Using a minor action, you can temporarily attune to a single basic Arcane or Cosmic Element for 1 hour for the purpose of spellcasting. This temporary attunement does not increase your Max MP. This feature can be used once and is reusable after taking a Long Break or Full Rest.

features.name: Attunement Slot +1
features.description: You gain +1 additional Attunement Slot. Each Attunement Slot increases your maximum MP by 10. (Stacks with other Attunement Slots.)

features.name: Warcasting +
features.description: (This feature augments the Warcasting feature with new functions.) You can use your minor action to enchant non-machinarm weapons you are wielding to make them deal the damage Type of an element you’re attuned to and change the damage Method to Spell instead of Weapon. This feature overrides the weapon’s damage Type even if it was already enhanced by spells, but it retains the spell’s bonuses. This feature lasts for 1 hour and you can dismiss this effect with your minor action.

features.name: Break Focus +
features.description: (This feature augments the Break Focus feature with new functions.) Attacks you make on a target that’s focusing on spells or other effects are made with Edge.

features.name: Spirit Burst: Cancel Action +
features.description: (2 Spirit Tokens) (Instant)(This feature augments the Cancel Action feature with new functions.) The Cancel Action Attack Roll you make with this feature is made with Edge.

basic_disciplines.name: Channeler
basic_disciplines.strengths: Channelers can use their eidolons to provide the party with additional frontline defense while safely standing at the back. They can also use eidolons to attack apparitions. A Phantasmancer’s eidolon attacks with accuracy while a Talismancer’s eidolon accumulates damage over time.
basic_disciplines.weaknesses: Channelers have below-average hit points and don’t have many Mind Points either. They need to always maintain a safe distance from their enemies.

gear_suggestions.others: Without the need for weapons, you can bring more items with you.

features.name: Command Eidolon
features.description: Channelers command spiritual manifestations known as eidolons. These eidolons have various forms and abilities based on the Channeler Class chosen. You can use actions to summon, dismiss, move, or attack with your eidolon.

features.name: Phantasm Mastery
features.description: (Adventuring Feature) Your Class eidolon is called phantasm and you can only have 1 phantasm at a time. A phantasm is an invisible and incorporeal medium sized hovering spirit that can pass through walls and solid objects. Using your minor action, you can see and hear through its senses for 12 seconds (1 round).

features.name: Phantasm Combat
features.description: Your phantasm eidolon has specific attributes and abilities: Summoning range: 10m (1 zone) from eidolon vessel; Operating range: 10m (1 zone) from eidolon vessel; Movement: 10m (1 zone); Attack range: 0 (melee); Damage: 4 HP Astral Eidolon. It has 0 HP and Defense and Fortitudes that are identical to your own. It's immune to HP & MP damage. You possess Edge in your phantasm's eidolon Combat Rolls unless the target possesses astral vision or another method of detecting invisible beings. Phantasms are incorporeal and impervious to harm or influence. Each time you voluntarily move, your phantasm can also move the same distance as you as a Free Action.

features.name: Talisman Spirit Mastery
features.description: (Adventuring Feature) Your Class eidolon is called talisman spirit and you can create as many copies of them as you can summon. Talisman spirits are small corporeal landbound elemental creatures. They have limited intelligence and can perform simple tasks.

features.name: Spirit Combat
features.description: Summoning limit: 2 talisman spirits summoned at a time. Summoning range: 10m (1 zone) from eidolon vessel. Operating range: 100m (10 zones) from eidolon vessel. Movement: 10m (1 zone). Attack range: 0 (melee). Damage: 4 HP (chosen element) Eidolon. HP: 1, Defense and Fortitudes: same as the Channeler. It’s immune to HP & MP damage of the same element type. When your talisman spirit’s HP is reduced to 0, it vanishes back into its vessel. When you summon a talisman spirit, you can choose its element from the following choices: fire, water, and wood. The damage Type it deals is the same as its element and it is immune to damage of the same element. When you deal damage to a target with your talisman spirit, it latches onto the target and will move along with it, until you order it to attack another target. At the end of your turn, roll 1d6. Targets take that much HP Eidolon damage for each spirit latched on to it. The damage Type is the same as your talisman spirit’s element. You can use your minor action to change the element of a summoned talisman spirit.

features.name: Spirit Burst: Quick Command
features.description: (3 Spirit Tokens) By spending 3 Spirit Tokens as a Free Action on your turn, you have a temporary Major Action that you can use to command your eidolon with.

features.name: Flurry Attack
features.description: Your phantasm utilizes the opening in your target’s Defense to overwhelm it with a flurry of attacks. When your phantasm deals Excess Damage, the Excess Damage is multiplied by 2.

features.name: Spirit Combat +
features.description: (This feature augments the Spirit Combat feature with new functions.) You can now have up to a maximum of 3 talisman spirits summoned at a time. You can now summon talisman spirits of wind, earth, and metal elements. A target latched onto by a talisman spirit now takes 1d6 +4 damage at the end of your turn.

features.name: Defender Eidolon
features.description: When any of your eidolons are in the same zone as you, you receive a +1 bonus to your Defense. This feature does not stack even if you have multiple eidolons in the same zone.

features.name: Phantasm Mastery +
features.description: (This feature augments the Phantasm Mastery feature with new functions.) When you see through your phantasm, you gain astral sight.

features.name: Flurry Attack +
features.description: (This feature overwrites the Flurry Attack feature and doesn’t stack with it.) When your phantasm deals Excess Damage, the Excess Damage is multiplied by 3. You gain a +1 bonus to eidolon Combat Rolls when attacking with your phantasm.

features.name: Talisman Spirit Mastery +
features.description: (This feature augments the Talisman Spirit Mastery feature with new functions.) Your talisman spirits can now fly and carry up to one Item Slot’s worth of objects or up to 5kg in weight.

features.name: Spirit Combat ++
features.description: (This feature augments the Spirit Combat feature with new functions.) You can now have up to a maximum of 3 talisman spirits summoned at a time. You can now summon talisman spirits of wind, earth, and metal elements. A target latched onto by a talisman spirit now takes 1d6 +4 damage at the end of your turn.

features.name: Defender Eidolon +
features.description: (Instant) (This feature augments the Defender Eidolon feature with new functions.) You can use your minor action at any time, even outside of your turn, to instantly make minor action commands to your eidolon.

features.name: Flurry Attack ++
features.description: (This feature overwrites the Flurry Attack + feature and doesn’t stack with it.) When your phantasm deals Excess Damage, the Excess Damage is multiplied by 4. You gain a +1 bonus to eidolon Combat Rolls when attacking with your phantasm. (Does not stack with previous version.) When your phantasm deals damage, you can choose to deal Order or Chaos damage Types instead of Astral.

features.name: Spirit Guardian
features.description: You can use all your summoning power to summon a single powerful Medium sized spirit guardian of any Arcane Element. The spirit guardian operates similarly to talisman spirits but with enhanced capabilities.

features.name: Spirit Burst: Quick Command +
features.description: (3 Spirit Tokens) (Instant) (This feature augments the Quick Command feature with new functions.) You can now use this Spirit Burst at any instant, even outside of your turn. If you hit a target while it’s performing an action, the action is canceled and expended.

features.name: Martial Weaponry
features.description: Weapons you have Mastery in become part of your martial arts repertoire. Your Weapon Combat Rolls can be considered Martial Arts Combat Rolls. Your base Martial Arts damage is 4 HP. When you deal damage with your weapon, you can choose to deal the weapon’s damage or your Martial Arts damage. The damage Type is the same as your weapon and you may choose the damage Method that benefits you the most.

features.name: Battle Instinct
features.description: Gauge other creature’s willingness to fight. By looking into the eyes of a creature within 10m (1 zone) of you for 12 seconds (1 round), you know if that creature will fight you or flee if you ready yourself to fight it.

features.name: Dueling Stance
features.description: Assume a dueling stance to optimize your Melee Attack’s lethality. When you make a Melee Attack at a target, but before you roll your dice, you can use your minor action to swiftly assume a duelling stance. Double the damage of the first instance of damage you deal with that attack. This effect wears off after you make your attack, regardless of whether you hit or miss. You can only use this feature once per turn.

features.name: Clear Vision
features.description: Your highly trained eyesight reveals more Information to you. You roll with Edge to Detect things by sight. All your Ranged Attacks against stationary targets that are not part of an enemy unit are made with Edge.

features.name: Trick Shot
features.description: Curve or bounce projectiles to hit multiple targets with one shot. You can use a minor action to mark two separate targets. When you make your next Ranged Attack, your projectile can curve and ignore zone cover to home into your marked targets in your preferred sequence as long as they’re within the range of your weapon. Make a Simultaneous Ranged Attack Roll against all the marked targets. You can mark a Horde unit target up to two times, counting each mark as separate targets. The marks disappear after you make an attack. You can also use your Free Action to unmark your targets at any time. You can only use this feature once per turn.

features.name: Eagle Eyes
features.description: Exploit your enemies’ openings and strike their weak spots. When you make an Attack Roll and both your dice display the same number (such as 4 and 4, 2 and 2, etc), with the exception of fumble (1 and 1, or snake eyes), your attack automatically hits, and becomes a critical hit. If you hit your enemy with this feature and your Attack Roll is below your enemy’s Defense, you deal 0 Excess Damage (You cannot deal negative Excess Damage).

features.name: Seen It All
features.description: You are always ready for trouble and can’t be Surprised. Additionally, you can’t be Disarmed of the weapon you wield by Maneuvers or other effects.

features.name: Spirit Burst: Skill Over Luck
features.description: (3 Spirit Tokens) (Instant) Skilled warriors create their luck. After making an Attack Roll, you can spend 3 Spirit Tokens as a Free Action to increase or decrease the result on the face of one of the dice by 1 point.

features.name: Battle Instinct +
features.description: (This feature augments the Battle Instinct feature with new functions.) When there are hostile creatures within 20m (2 zones) of you, even if they’re invisible and inaudible, you will be alerted of their presence by your instinct. If you’re asleep, you will be awakened immediately. You know the rough position (zone) of the nearest hostile creature.

features.name: Counter Stance
features.description: (Instant) Anticipate enemy attacks and strike them first. When you or the zone you occupy become the target of an attack or effect, you can use your minor action to instantly make a Major Melee Attack against your assailant first. Your opponent can continue its action if it survives. Obviously, your assailant needs to be within your Melee Attack’s range for you to perform this.

features.name: Clear Vision +
features.description: (Adventuring Feature)(This feature augments the Clear Vision feature with new functions.) While not in combat, you can immediately recognize visual illusions created by practical or magical means.

features.name: Trick Shot +
features.description: (This feature augments the Trick Shot feature with new functions.) You can now use two minor actions to mark three separate targets for your trickshot. You can mark a Horde unit target up to three times, counting each mark as a separate target.

features.name: Eagle Eyes +
features.description: (This feature augments the Eagle Eyes feature with new functions.) Whenever your Eagle Eyes feature is activated, you gain 1 Spirit Token.

features.name: Seen It All +
features.description: (Instant) (This feature augments the Seen It All feature with new functions.) You can instantly spend any amount of Spirit Tokens as Free Action to increase your Turn Speed. You increase your Turn Order by 1 for every Spirit Token spent and the maximum Turn Order attainable with this feature is 9.

features.name: Spirit Burst: Skill Over Luck +
features.description: (3 Spirit Tokens) (Instant) (This feature augments the Skill Over Luck feature with new functions.) After making an Attack Roll, you can spend 3 Spirit Tokens to increase or decrease the result on the face of both dice by one point.

features.name: Vanguard Commander
features.description: Your expertise in melee combat lets you dominate the frontlines. All melee weapons you use receive a +2 bonus to their base weapon damage. (Also applies to your rides’ melee damage.)

features.name: Leadership Aura
features.description: Instill awe and confidence with your inspiring presence. Using your minor action, you can emanate your leadership aura 30m (3 zones) out from you. Any Appeal Rolls made by you or your allies inside the aura are made with Edge. Your aura lasts for 12 seconds (1 round), and ends at the start of your next turn if used during combat. This feature can be used once and is reusable after taking a Full Rest.

features.name: General’s Pressure
features.description: Suppress your enemy’s combat effectiveness. When a target in the same zone as you deals an instance of HP or MP damage to your allies, whether it affects a single target or multiple other targets through a Zone Effect or a Simultaneous Attack, you can use your minor action to reduce the damage by 3, or 6 if you also spend a Spirit Token. This feature can be used outside of your own turn.

features.name: Whirlwind Strike
features.description: Mercilessly sweep through enemies like a whirlwind. After making your Major Attack, you can use your minor action to make a Follow-Up Melee Attack called a Whirlwind Strike at a target you have not already damaged in the same turn, including those on the same enemy unit. You can make as many Follow-Up Attacks as you want, as long as each target is separate and you have the minor actions to perform them. You can target enemy Horde units as many times as you want with this feature since they provide an endless amount of new targets.

features.name: Battle Rider
features.description: While you’re riding a mount or vehicle, you and your ride form a singular unit with one target, centered on you. You become the sole target of the unit and your vehicle cannot be targeted by attacks or effects unless you allow it. You can now use both hands to wield your weapons even when riding. You receive an additional +2 weapon Damage Bonus on all damage done using your rides. (Stacks with the Vanguard Commander feature.)

features.name: Spirit Burst: Blazing Spirit
features.description: Raise your spirit at the cost of your own health. Once during your turn, you can use your Free Action to gain a Spirit Token by taking 5 HP Damage. This damage cannot be reduced by features, barriers spells, or any other means.
